PRs missing backports.title: gh-133467: Fix typeobject `tp_base` race in free threading
PRs missing backports.body:
# Issue

#133467 

# Proposed Changes

- Fix the race of `PyTypeObject::tp_base` between typemember `__base__` and set of `__bases__`.
- Add test case in unit test.

# Comment

## Root cause

Since the `__bases__`'s getter and setter are protetcted by `TYPE_LOCK`.

https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/289360ae63933c8956f87307ff091ec9ed19afed/Objects/typeobject.c#L1916

https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/289360ae63933c8956f87307ff091ec9ed19afed/Objects/typeobject.c#L586-L596

So it is safe for concurrency.

But the update of bases will re-evaluate the `tp_base` again and would be in race with the direct access of `__base__`.

https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/289360ae63933c8956f87307ff091ec9ed19afed/Objects/typeobject.c#L1459

## How to fix

At the beginning I try to use the `TYPE_LOCK` to protect the `tb_base` for `__base__` access.

But it's a directly memory access by offset and I have no more idea except StopTheWorld.

So I add a STW for the updating of `tp_base` in setter.

Please let me know if we have a better way for it. 😊

## TSAN output for this race

Here is the TSAN core output of this race.


PRs missing backports.title: gh-90871: fix connection backlog offset in asyncio
PRs missing backports.body:
<!--
Thanks for your contribution!
Please read this comment in its entirety. It's quite important.

# Pull Request title

It should be in the following format:

```
gh-NNNNNN: Summary of the changes made
```

Where: gh-NNNNNN refers to the GitHub issue number.

Most PRs will require an issue number. Trivial changes, like fixing a typo, do not need an issue.

# Backport Pull Request title

If this is a backport PR (PR made against branches other than `main`),
please ensure that the PR title is in the following format:

```
[X.Y] <title from the original PR> (GH-NNNNNN)
```

Where: [X.Y] is the branch name, for example: [3.13].

GH-NNNNNN refers to the PR number from `main`.

-->


<!-- gh-issue-number: gh-90871 -->
* Issue: gh-90871
<!-- /gh-issue-number -->

PRs missing backports.title: gh-130595: Keep traceback alive for WITH_EXCEPT_START
PRs missing backports.body:
The WITH_EXCEPT_START opcode is getting the traceback from the exception object and then passing it down via a vectorcall, but only after decref'ing the traceback. 

But the exception object can have the only reference to the traceback. If the receiver of the traceback does something to cause the exception's trace back to be replaced, then uses the traceback, they access dangling pointer. The traceback shouldn't solely be kept alive by the exception object which can be mutated.

<!-- gh-issue-number: gh-130595 -->
* Issue: gh-130595
<!-- /gh-issue-number -->

PRs missing backports.title: gh-130052: Fix some exceptions on error paths in _testexternalinspection

Some error paths don't set Exceptions.
This PR fixes them.
